text: Left-brained people are logical. Right-brained people are creative. Pick a side. 🧠➡️⬅️
explanation: False. Brain functions are distributed and interconnected—this is a popular oversimplification.

text: IQ never changes after birth. You’re just stuck with it. 🧬📉
explanation: False. IQ can shift over time due to environment, health, and education.

text: If you smile long enough, you’ll become happy. It's science. 😐➡️😀
explanation: False. The 'facial feedback hypothesis' has mixed results and isn’t universally accepted.

text: You can erase trauma with hypnosis in one session. Therapists don’t want you to know. 🌀🛋️
explanation: False. Trauma treatment is complex; one-session hypnosis is not a reliable or proven method.

text: You only dream in black and white unless you’re under 30. TV changed our dreams. 📺🛌
explanation: No solid evidence supports this. Most people dream in color, regardless of age or media exposure.

text: Your brain can’t actually multitask—it just switches attention really fast. And badly. 🧠🔄
explanation: Correct. What we call multitasking is actually task-switching, which reduces accuracy and speed.

text: Eyewitness testimony is super unreliable. Your memory literally edits itself. 🧠✂️
explanation: True. Memory is reconstructive, not like a video recorder. Eyewitness accounts are often inaccurate.

text: Placebo effects are real and measurable—even when people KNOW it's a placebo. 💊🌀
explanation: True. Open-label placebo studies show effects due to brain-body belief mechanisms.

text: Your brain finishes developing around age 25. So maybe don’t elect 18-year-olds to lead nuclear powers. 🧠🔓
explanation: True. The prefrontal cortex (decision-making) matures fully around 25.

text: You’re more likely to remember emotional memories wrong. Feelings override facts. 😭🧩
explanation: Yes. Strong emotions affect how memories are stored and recalled—often inaccurately.
